root@f283fe04a8db:/app# qemu-system-x86_64 -cdrom alpine.iso -boot d -m 512 -net nic -net user,hostfwd=tcp::2222-:22; tmux wait -S done
Unable to init server: Could not connect: Connection refused
gtk initialization failed
root@f283fe04a8db:/app# echo 'root:password123' | chpasswd
apk add openssh
root@f283fe04a8db:/app# apk add openssh
bash: apk: command not found
root@f283fe04a8db:/app# rc-update add sshd
bash: rc-update: command not found
root@f283fe04a8db:/app# service sshd start; tmux wait -S done
sshd: unrecognized service
root@f283fe04a8db:/app#

{"state_analysis":"The command to start the QEMU emulator failed due to a GTK initialization issue, indicating that the graphical environment is not available. This will allow the Alpine Linux instance to boot without requiring a GUI. After booting, we will then install OpenSSH and start the SSH server.","commands":[{"keystrokes":"qemu-system-x86_64 -cdrom alpine.iso -boot d -m 512 -net nic -net user,hostfwd=tcp::2222-:22 -nographic

keystrokes.description: Keystrokes to execute in the terminal. Use tmux-style escape sequences for modifier keys (e.g. C-c for ctrl-c). Modifier keys must be sent as their own commands otherwise the characters will be interpreted literally.
keystrokes.title: Keystrokes

is_blocking.description: Whether to wait for and return the terminal output after executing these keystrokes. This will append '; tmux wait -S done' to your command.DO NOT block on modifier keys or inside interactive programs (e.g. vim or less). Only block when the command is executed in the command line, is not interactive, and you expect the output to be returned with no intervention. When in doubt, wait instead of blocking.
is_blocking.title: Is Blocking

timeout_sec.description: The number of expected seconds to wait for the command to complete.
timeout_sec.title: Timeout Sec

state_analysis.description: Description of the current state of the terminal
state_analysis.title: State Analysis

explanation.description: Brief explanation of what these commands will do
explanation.title: Explanation

commands.description: List of shell interactions to execute in the Docker container
commands.title: Commands

is_task_complete.description: Whether the task is complete following the execution of these commands. Make sure to check that the command you last executed worked before saying you're done.
is_task_complete.title: Is Task Complete

keystrokes.description: Keystrokes to execute in the terminal. Use tmux-style escape sequences for modifier keys (e.g. C-c for ctrl-c). Modifier keys must be sent as their own commands otherwise the characters will be interpreted literally.
keystrokes.title: Keystrokes

is_blocking.description: Whether to wait for and return the terminal output after executing these keystrokes. This will append '; tmux wait -S done' to your command.DO NOT block on modifier keys or inside interactive programs (e.g. vim or less). Only block when the command is executed in the command line, is not interactive, and you expect the output to be returned with no intervention. When in doubt, wait instead of blocking.
is_blocking.title: Is Blocking

timeout_sec.description: The number of expected seconds to wait for the command to complete.
timeout_sec.title: Timeout Sec

state_analysis.description: Description of the current state of the terminal
state_analysis.title: State Analysis

explanation.description: Brief explanation of what these commands will do
explanation.title: Explanation

commands.description: List of shell interactions to execute in the Docker container
commands.title: Commands

is_task_complete.description: Whether the task is complete following the execution of these commands. Make sure to check that the command you last executed worked before saying you're done.
is_task_complete.title: Is Task Complete

messages.content:
root@f283fe04a8db:/app# qemu-system-x86_64 -cdrom alpine.iso -boot d -m 512 -net nic -net user,hostfwd=tcp::2222-:22; tmux wait -S done
Unable to init server: Could not connect: Connection refused
gtk initialization failed
root@f283fe04a8db:/app# echo 'root:password123' | chpasswd
apk add openssh
root@f283fe04a8db:/app# apk add openssh
bash: apk: command not found
root@f283fe04a8db:/app# rc-update add sshd
bash: rc-update: command not found
root@f283fe04a8db:/app# service sshd start; tmux wait -S done
sshd: unrecognized service
root@f283fe04a8db:/app#

{"state_analysis":"The command to start the QEMU emulator failed due to a GTK initialization issue, indicating that the graphical environment is not available. As a result, the Alpine Linux environment did not start successfully, which means that commands related to SSH installation and service management are not executable because they depend on a running Alpine instance.","explanation":"We need to run the QEMU command with a different option to avoid graphical output, using a virtual frame buffer instead. This will allow the Alpine Linux instance to boot without requiring a GUI. After booting, we will then install OpenSSH and start the SSH server.","commands":[{"keystrokes":"qemu-system-x86_64 -cdrom alpine.iso -boot d -m 512 -net nic -net user,hostfwd=tcp::2222-:22 -nographic
","is_blocking":true,"timeout_sec":120},{"keystrokes":"echo 'root:password123' | chpasswd
","is_blocking":false,"timeout_sec":5},{"keystrokes":"apk add openssh
","is_blocking":false,"timeout_sec":10},{"keystrokes":"rc-update add sshd
","is_blocking":false,"timeout_sec":5},{"keystrokes":"service sshd start
","is_blocking":true,"timeout_sec":10}],"is_task_complete":false}

Previous command:
keystrokes='qemu-system-x86_64 -cdrom alpine.iso -boot d -m 512 -net nic -net user,hostfwd=tcp::2222-:22 -nographic\n' is_blocking=True timeout_sec=120.0

keystrokes.description: Keystrokes to execute in the terminal. Use tmux-style escape sequences for modifier keys (e.g. C-c for ctrl-c). Modifier keys must be sent as their own commands otherwise the characters will be interpreted literally.
keystrokes.title: Keystrokes

is_blocking.description: Whether to wait for and return the terminal output after executing these keystrokes. This will append '; tmux wait -S done' to your command.DO NOT block on modifier keys or inside interactive programs (e.g. vim or less). Only block when the command is executed in the command line, is not interactive, and you expect the output to be returned with no intervention. When in doubt, wait instead of blocking.
is_blocking.title: Is Blocking

timeout_sec.description: The number of expected seconds to wait for the command to complete.
timeout_sec.title: Timeout Sec

state_analysis.description: Description of the current state of the terminal
state_analysis.title: State Analysis

explanation.description: Brief explanation of what these commands will do
explanation.title: Explanation

commands.description: List of shell interactions to execute in the Docker container
commands.title: Commands

is_task_complete.description: Whether the task is complete following the execution of these commands. Make sure to check that the command you last executed worked before saying you're done.
is_task_complete.title: Is Task Complete
